alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 31 at 4:57AM AKST until January 04 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Blowing snow may reduce visibility to one quarter mile or less at times. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...The Northwestern Alaska coast from Point Hope and Point Lay. * WHEN...From Monday morning through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Travel could be very difficult at times. Large snow drifts can form. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
